Description: Fragment of sharp concave marble moulding with delicately sanded upper surface. On the light grey and partly glazed marble no traces of paint were found.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'second temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: This fragment belongs together with B 421, B 423 and B 424 to a leaf moulding to which fragments B 410, B 411 and B 422 build the corner piece. Published (Petrie 1886, Pl. 14,7; Altekamp 137ff. No. 2; 548 Fig. 125)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B421)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIV, no. 7)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.28, p.332, pl. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.37) (Phase 3)
